facts.title: The Moon
facts.content: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite, orbiting at an average distance of 384,400 kilometers.

facts.title: Lunar Exploration
facts.content: Humans first landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969, during the Apollo 11 mission.

facts.title: Moon Phases
facts.content: The Moon goes through phases because of the relative positions of the Earth, Moon, and Sun.

facts.title: Lunar Surface
facts.content: The Moon's surface is covered with craters, formed by asteroid and meteorite impacts over billions of years.

facts.title: Gravity
facts.content: The Moon's gravity is about 1/6th of Earth's gravity, making it easier to move and jump.
